choices.C: VM1, VM2, VM3, VMA, VMB, and VMC
choices.D: VM1, VM3, VMA, and VMC only

discussion.content:
D: VM1, VM3, VMA, and VMC only
Explanation: only the West Europe VMs:
You need a vault in every Azure region that contains VMs you want to back up. You can't back up to a different region.
Azure Backup supports application-consistent backups for both Windows and Linux VMs
There is no restriction that prevents backups from being performed on a Recovery Services Vault located in another resource Group
Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/backup-recovery

Selected Answer: D
D is correct as it is the same location.

What should you do for ContReg1?

choices.A: Enable encryption by using a customer-managed key.

comments.content:
Good to know: 
Only the Azure Container Registry Premium Tier supports Content Trust.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/container-registry/container-registry-skus

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
To ensure that you can push and pull signed images for your container registry, you need to follow these steps:

Sign Your Images: Use Docker Content Trust (DCT) to sign your images before pushing them to the registry.

Push Signed Images: Push the signed images to your container registry.

Pull Signed Images: Pull the signed images from your container registry.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
correct is D Content trust in Azure Container Registry allows you to sign images, ensuring their integrity and authenticity when they are pushed and pulled

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have an Azure subscription that has the Azure container registries shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You plan to use ACR Tasks and configure private endpoint connections.

Which container registries support ACR Tasks and private endpoints? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Only Premium Tier supports Private Endpoints:
Ref: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/container-registry/container-registry-skus

comments.content: I agree, and the given answer is correct

discussion.content:
ContReg1 (Premium): Supports both ACR Tasks and private endpoints.
ContReg2 (Standard): Supports ACR Tasks but does not support private endpoints.
ContReg3 (Basic): Supports ACR Tasks but does not support private endpoints.
So, ContReg1 is the only container registry that supports both ACR Tasks and private endpoints.

correct
ACR Tasks:
ContReg1 (Premium)
ContReg2 (Standard)
ContReg3 (Basic)

Private Endpoints:
ContReg1 (Premium)

So, ContReg1 supports both ACR Tasks and private endpoints, while ContReg2 supports ACR Tasks but not private endpoints, and ContReg3 supports ACR Tasks but not private endpoints.
should use (Azure Container Registry) in the question , instant of ACR task.

Private Endpoint: Contreg1 (Premium) Only
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/container-registry/container-registry-skus

basic tier does not support ACR tasks. Only ContReg1 & ContReg2 can do this.

questions.question_text:

You need to ensure that NGINX is available on all the virtual machines after they are deployed.

choices.B: Deployment Center in Azure App Service

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
we can use set-AzVMDscConfiguretion cmdlet to run one post-deployment Dsc script to install NGINX in the VM, publish-AzVMDscConfiguration is used to only publish one Dsc script to the Azure Automation
